website_summaries.verdict: Its protective sheath keeps fish from being harmed by the heating unit, but may also affect temperature accuracy.
pros: Users like the LED status indicator
Glass appears sturdy, and plastic protector keeps fish and turtles alike from being harmed
cons: Operates erratically  after a short period of use, some owners report
Water doesn’t flow fast enough around heater, reducing efficiency

customer_reviews.title: Failed after 3 weeks...
customer_reviews.text: Heater worked for about 3 weeks. Now it's notncycling on. I seen the blue LED indicator and the temp was 73.5 when it's set to 77. I unplugged it and plugged it back in and it's not warmed the water up. I have it in a 40g tank and it's rated for well over that. I was really looking for a quality product but this is her disappointing. I had to buy a temporary heater or I risk losing my cichlids.
customer_reviews.author: Armando

customer_reviews.title: Lots of issues
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a few of these and each one had different issues. The main problem is the temperature control. It would get stuck and would be impossible to change the temperature. Another issue was they would say low flow even when directly in the flow of the filter. I have a really old one of these I'm still using but it's pretty difficult to change temperature, luckily it's stuck on the temp I need. Really wanted to like the new ones but had to return each one I ordered.
customer_reviews.author: dsp

customer_reviews.title: not what they used to be
customer_reviews.text: We used these for years without any problems. Came time to replace them and something has changed. The quality is no longer there. These were purchased in April (now it's September) and they have BOTH stopped working correctly, Spoke to 2 local pet stores and they both said something changed with in Fluval's company that they were receiving bad batches of heaters so they will no longer carry this brand. VERY DISAPPOINTED to say the least.
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: Buy a true and trusted ehiem jager. Fluval e300 is unreliable
customer_reviews.text: This heater looks great and I like the digital readout. Have had some problems with it though. It fails to cycle on at times and my tanks temp will drop. Called Fluval and they were basically no help. All they could say is I need to clean the heater, and that certain things can cause it to malfunction. Without naming what those things were. If you have a tank with expensive livestock like a reef tank, absolutely avoid this heater. It is not reliable and could cost you hundreds or thousands of dollars in dead livestock.
customer_reviews.author: PS

customer_reviews.title: Your tank needs this
customer_reviews.text: Bought it as a Amazon warehouse deal. It was missing one of the three suction cups but otherwise fine. Thought it was malfunctioning until I realized that the previous owner had set it to 85 degrees. Once I adjusted it back down to 77, it works great! Digital display is very cool and comforting when you have a couple hundred dollars of family members under its management. Very obvious if heater is malfunctioning or not big enough as the display flashes green/ blue if under temp and red if over temp. Even on the back wall of my 75 gallon tank, it was very noticeable. Super happy!
customer_reviews.author: Steve J

customer_reviews.title: Awsome heater
customer_reviews.text: So happy with this purchase definitely worth the money to pay for a fluval heater. I keep my house at 72 to 74 and was not using a heater before buying this on my 125 since I hadnt made up my mind on what would be best since I dont like the heaters in my other tanks. I set it at 76 and it took about 12 to 14 hours to stabilize the temp in this tank and after 24 hours the tank has come alive. I will be replacing the heaters in my other tanks with fluval heaters.
customer_reviews.author: Dartswinger73

customer_reviews.title: Excellent heater
customer_reviews.text: Fluval is a quality product and this heater has all the extras like a guard to protect the fish. I love love love the digital readout and the colors to visually warn if temp is out of range it was set. I love it so much I ordered a second to replace a older fluval heater. I highly recommend two just in case one fails!! And trust me one will fail and at the worst time!!! A+++ for fluval.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Follow the advice on here and you will have the best digital thermometer on the market
customer_reviews.text: I put this in my 75 after the previous aqueon shorted, went to 96 degrees, and killed 5 of my Rainbows. My setup is planted with a decent current. I listened to advice and placed it at an angle and have had 0 hiccups since day 1. The lever to change the temp is a little stiff, but still easier that turning a knob. As far as accuracy... I have a secondary thermometer with the probe next to it and they read .1 degrees F away from each other at most. 5 stars and I'll be replacing all of the heaters in my tanks with these as they age out.
customer_reviews.author: Nik

customer_reviews.title: LF Error?  Just put it above an air stone/bubbler
customer_reviews.text: Great heater! I have it on my 65 gallon tank and it has been keeping the temperature stable. You do have to play with its placement a little in order to get the right water flow. Otherwise it'll keep flashing LF (Low flow) all the time. I found that placing it above a small air stone works very well in keeping the right flow. You need enough water movement across it in order to heat the tank properly. Otherwise it'll just heat that little spot where it's at.
customer_reviews.author: Lycramosa

customer_reviews.title: Worthless Junk..DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: This 300 watt heater is garbage, It will not even heat a 30 gallon tank to 80 degrees. I have went through two of these..JUNK!! I received no help from Amazon or Fluval with this item. I keep expensive Discus fish and almost lost some due to this malfunctioning piece of junk. Amazon won't help because it's been over 30 days, I understand the policy, but come on!! Two in a row, an exception should be made. Fluval sent me an email explaining how a heater works, and quickly dismissed the issue. I'm extremely dissatisfied with the heater and the treatment from Amazon. I've been in the hobby for over a decade...you've been warned!!
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: I am livid
customer_reviews.text: I received this heater 2 days ago and at first everything seemed to be perfectly fine. I had the temp set to 79 and my betta fish community seemed instantly happy. It has been 2 days and I come home from being out all day to see the temp at 76 and I lost 3 fish. Are you kidding me the temp is still set to the correct setting.. I even tried to raise the temperature.. with no error codes... Nothing. What the hell?!?! Knowing Fluval as a company that across the board makes good products I'm hoping this is a defect. Will contact customer service in the morning.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph V.

customer_reviews.title: Nice units. Not sold on output.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice equipment. Easy to mount and read, my only issue with them is they seem to under preform. I have 2 in a 150 with good flow, one works great and always keeps temp. The other always has issues, cold or hot it can't make up its mind. At night I can clearly see one of the units has nice heat output and visible heat element. The other doesn't even do any visible heat output and is always blue.
customer_reviews.author: Brian R

customer_reviews.title: It's simply not good at that
customer_reviews.text: For a 300 watt heater, this thing sure does take a LONG time to heat water up. I have a separate old 300 watt heater that heats water SIGNIFICANTLY faster than this. I had to replace that one because the sensor died - it just stayed on. I'd cook the aquarium! This one does work and does regulate the temperature, but don't expect it to handle temperature swings very well. It's simply not good at that.
customer_reviews.author: LordGideon

customer_reviews.title: Turtles love it
customer_reviews.text: My red eared sliders love to lay on the heater. They were getting pretty bad burns on their shell. I switched to this one and I'm happy I did. The guard protects them. Works tremendously. The temperature is off, but it might be because I have it fully submerged and horizontal at the bottom of the water. I just turn it up a few more degrees to adjust and it's all good.
customer_reviews.author: alexander

customer_reviews.title: Way to over hyped
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited about this heater i kept hearing that it’s the best aquarium heater but I have to say I was super disappointed in this product, it’s temperature reading is always wrong it takes forever to start heating up the tank and the instructions do not explain what the colors mean or anything I had to look it up on google to find out, fluval dropped the ball I will stick with my inline heater from now on
customer_reviews.author: Ravenandmatt

customer_reviews.title: NEW FAVORITE AQUARIUM HEATER! Switching the 6 heaters I have to Fluval E Series!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had numerous aquarium heaters spanning probably at least 9-10 different brands, Ranging from 50w-500w & this is BY FAR my favorite. Ultra sleek looking, SUPER easy to set up, to install, to use, to read etc. Love that the thermometer is built in & easily read with its bright LED screen..I am in the process of switching the other 6 aquarium heaters I’m utilizing over to the Fluval E Series!
customer_reviews.author: King Adrock

customer_reviews.title: Fluval works!
customer_reviews.text: Fluval saved me again. I tried a similar heater that was meant for turtles but it continued to give me problems. I was not able to regulate the temp since it was preset. The fluval heater heats to the temp I want and I also enjoy the color changing mechanism. Im confident now that I need to stick to what I know. I have the Fluval U4 and that works great too!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Kind of sucks
customer_reviews.text: I just purchased one of these and I'm very impressed with it it has a very nice read out it's hard to start off with from the beginning you have to let it come to temperature with the tank 1st and make sure you put it somewhere with good circulation I set it at 75.5 and it still 75.5. And I also took a while for it to come to temperature Doesn't heat up really fast needs time for large temperature changes it sucks not very good heater for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas

customer_reviews.title: Very VERY good heater.
customer_reviews.text: I live in Rural Colorado in a little mountain town. Being off-grid you count watts. So I wanted to keep a 55 gallon drum from freezing in winter at 8500 ft. Found this unit and it has held it's own in 0 degree nights. The smallest cattle heater I have found is 600 watts so this saved me power and money taboot.
customer_reviews.author: Gandolf

customer_reviews.title: Can’t complain at all.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Love the look and how intuitive it is. Follow directions for setup and you can’t go wrong. I have it set up vertical instead of the hobby recommended 45 degree angle. It’s next to my in tank canister so water flow and temps feel nice.
customer_reviews.author: Poison Ivy

customer_reviews.title: Works but has issues
customer_reviews.text: Few issues would be the temp control. I can turn the temp up no problem, turning it down is problematic. Also it captures air bubbles if too close to an air stone and it lets it out as a large air bubble once it fills a bit. The side suction is great, install is easy, and color coding is nice.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Failed design
customer_reviews.text: This heater is a joke...you have MAKE it work...by fully submerging it...going up fully to max temp...then down to lowest temp..then your desired temp..have 2 in a 55 and 2 in 75...50% of them do NOT work...avoid this heater and the headache of WONDERING if its on or not due to no 'on' light...let them Fix the problem before you buy... I have 25 years experience in the hobby.
customer_reviews.author: Nr

customer_reviews.title: Switch fails just after 4 months!
customer_reviews.text: Pros. - shows current temperature. - easy to use. - heater guard Cons. - you have to have current flowing directly at heater to get to temp. - ambient temp outside of tank was 62-65f in the winter had sufficient flow at heater and it could hardly get my 55 gal tank to 70f. - after 4 months of use temperature control switch has failed and I no longer can turn the temperature up. I am past my Amazon return policy and I will now contact Fluval directly to see what they will do. I will update when I find out what they do to make it right.
customer_reviews.author: david w. biehl

customer_reviews.title: Good Heater - Not Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my 100gl aquarium. It seems to work well - only problem is (as reported by other reviewers) you have to reset it now and then to allow it to recalibrate and show the correct temperature on the display. I have two additional thermometers in the tank so I can see that the heater is working and keeping the desired temp.
customer_reviews.author: CenCalGirl

customer_reviews.title: Would be great if it still worked.
customer_reviews.text: This thing was awesome for maybe 5 months. My Pleco especially loved it and used to lay close to it for hours. Now the temperature sensor keeps saying my tank is 79 degrees so it won’t heat. I’ve had no luck getting it to reset and read the water temperature correctly. I can still set the temperature I want it to heat to, but that’s no good if it consistently thinks the water is warmer than that temperature.
customer_reviews.author: Woody

customer_reviews.title: Great heater!
customer_reviews.text: Fast heat, all way stay in place, I have big cat fish, the heater will stay in same place all the time, I use the heater in the 55g tank work great.
customer_reviews.author: Irongohon

customer_reviews.title: Does not heat enough
customer_reviews.text: I tried putting water in about the same temp as what I wanted my tank. It has been a week and the heater is not heating. It keeps the water at about 70 degrees, but not any higher. I am extremely disappointed in this product and my tropical fishies are cold.
customer_reviews.author: Lyncati

customer_reviews.title: 1 steady temp
customer_reviews.text: Bought 3 of these. One for a 75g and two for the 125. All three of them have issues with the teperature control. They hold a steady temp at about 74-76 depending on the unit. I had two for about a year and bought another hoping for better luck, like they got bumped in the mail. I'll use it. Seems to be decent heaters, but not all that they advertise.
customer_reviews.author: Mieke

customer_reviews.title: ... for about 6 weeks now and I am very pleased. I enjoy the design and the easiness of ...
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this heater for about 6 weeks now and I am very pleased. I enjoy the design and the easiness of temperature control due to the LED display. After a few hick ups after installing with the low water flow as indicated on the display, I adjusted my strainer from my canister filter and haven't seen the warning again. Occasionally the background of the display turns blue, indicating that the temperature is at least 2 F below the set temperature, but it fixes itself within a day. It's most likely due to extreme temperature fluctuations in our area and house. Overall I love this product and would buy and recommend it anytime!
customer_reviews.author: NS2019

customer_reviews.title: Not happy
customer_reviews.text: Not happy with this product at all put in my aquarium to replace a old heater that was working set it to 81° the next morning my tank was at 73° the elements inside heater wherent even getting warm i feel like a completely like fluval shouldn't have these problems had i had not had a spare heater i could have lost lots of money in fish i am supposed to be receiving a new one in a week not ideal for the guy that needs one now that has already paid for a so called good product not sure i trust this product to do its job if the second one works
customer_reviews.author: justin e.

customer_reviews.title: ... for my 75 gallon turtle tank and it is great! I was worried because it was flashing at ...
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my 75 gallon turtle tank and it is great! I was worried because it was flashing at first and took a lot longer than I expected (a few hours) to heat the tank a few degrees. I left to go pick up my daughter from school and got back to it a few degrees higher. After some time it was at the set temperature. The red light indicator, blue light indicator, green light indicator and low flow indicator all work, too. It was a good price. I am very pleased with this product!
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: Great all around. No issues.
customer_reviews.text: For me this worked great. I read reviews about the error for lack of flow causing it to not work properly. After a few months of use it’s only had that “error” once and that was during a time when the pump was shut off so it does actually work. It looks good in the tank. Easy to reach in and toggle up or down when you loose power and need to reset temp.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good heater
customer_reviews.text: I already own one e300 its great im getting another one for the other end of my tank as i had an ich out break and it would only get my temp to 81 my target temp was 82 also im getting a 75 gallon tank so i figured i better get another one to heat more accurately also i love that it has the heater gaurd built into it i have an oscar and gets spooked sometimes and could break it
customer_reviews.author: Chad Smith

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste you money!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased 2 E300's for my 125 gallon. They seemed to work at first, but within 12 hours I started getting a low flow (LF) error. My tank has plenty of circulation (using a Fluval FX4). The temp was set to 78 but dropped to 75 with blue (cold) alert. There is also no indicator light for when the heaters are actually heating. Sending them back before they kill my fish.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Not able to maintain temp
customer_reviews.text: I bought the fluval 300 model but it is not able to maintain temps in my tank whereas a 250 watt cheaper heater is able to maintain temps. I have a Neptune Apex controller and am able to see the power draw of the heaters. The fluval does not stay on constantly even though the screen is blue. My cheap heater stays on constant and does not turn off until unless it reaches target temp. The fluval cycles on and off even though it hasn’t reached target temp. I believe this is a design flaw as I tried two different fluval heaters and they both behaved the same.
customer_reviews.author: Johnson T.

customer_reviews.title: OK
customer_reviews.text: Cons: Requires a fair amount of flow in order for it to quit displaying the "Low flow" symbol. No indicator light to know if it's actually "heating" . Doesn't seem to heat the water up to the set temperature unless there is good flow in the tank. It was always reading 1.5-2 degrees below my set temperature until I added 2 powerheads to my 180g tank. Pros: Easy to install, looks good, won't break easily. Works well with good flow. I like that the LCD is lit.
customer_reviews.author: brent heermans

customer_reviews.title: I have never had problems with even the cheapest of aquarium heaters in the past so I think this thing is just poor quality. Wen
customer_reviews.text: I have tried both the 200 watt and 300 watt version of this Fluval heater and both have the "Low Flow" issues that other reviewers have mentioned. I tried moving this thing all over the tank in an attempt to get it to function properly but it was either not able to hold the set temperature or would flash the "Low Flow" error. I have never had problems with even the cheapest of aquarium heaters in the past so I think this thing is just poor quality. Went back to the Eheim Jager and never being sold by the "fancy digital screen gimmick" again.
customer_reviews.author: Robert M Schroeder

customer_reviews.title: SaWeet !
customer_reviews.text: So,...read all reveiws,..and being burnt on heater after heater,.i leaped,..i bought 2 !, 50watt for 10 gal frog tank,..and 300watt for tropical 55 gal tank,..3 days in now,.im very happy,..directions were very easy,set up as well,..do not submerge completely,place near return water..acclimate, ..plug in,.it ran thru its test,..then final stage green light,..love to just look up and see that !..if red or flashing,..theres a problem,..saweet !,..ill update on its service in time ! The guwrd is a plus and it has a corner adapter, i used in 10 GAL,.so purchase and enjoy !
customer_reviews.author: Yvonne M. Zimmerman

customer_reviews.title: Class A Heater!
customer_reviews.text: I love anything Fluval. Honestly, most of the bad reviews on this heater are truly operator error, but there are so many videos to help you through any issue. I bought a 300w for my 55gal Labidochromis caeruleus tank and it heats like a pro. I have my temperature set 82° right now because I'm trying to breed.
customer_reviews.author: Sara Dortlon

customer_reviews.title: Fluval rocks!
customer_reviews.text: Woah! This heater is amazing. My old aqueon heater wasn't working anymore so I upgraded to this and it's keeping my temperature at a steady 79°F I bought the the 300 watts for my 65 Gallon. My aqueon heater was keeping the water at 73°F and my fishies weren't even swimming much they turned docile. This heater is amazing. I recommend it to everyone. P.S. I also suggest first time buyers to get fluvals canister filters they're great and I'm purchasing another one very soon
customer_reviews.author: Stalin R.

customer_reviews.title: So far its working as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Purchased after a little wrestling around with it i got it heating up...If water is to cold its good to start no more that 8° higher or it will flash blue alot...Turn it at a 45° angle with the bottom facing the return area of filter and its good..Took about 3hrs to get to safe temps..So basically so far so good..
customer_reviews.author: CeeW.717

customer_reviews.title: Works beautifly.
customer_reviews.text: It even has gone through meds. And is now also growing algae. Just wish I could have a little button that turns the backlight on the screen on and off. Other then that don't change anything. lol
customer_reviews.author: The Tech Guy

customer_reviews.title: Consider other options
customer_reviews.text: I hope I got a defective heater. ..I purchased the 300 watt for a total tank volume of 90 gallons...Heater never got tank above 77 and my home averages 70 to 72 degrees..back to ehiem...
customer_reviews.author: cezenzen

customer_reviews.title: Works for me
customer_reviews.text: Was very nervous about purchasing because reviews tended to be hit or miss- either love or hate this with no in between. For me they work perfect. As others said they need good water flow. I bought 2 for a 125 gallon. Put them on the back under the power filter and in my bubble wand stream. More than enough flow. Holds temp within 0.5 and digital display awesome. Plus these are perfect for stingrays with the guard :)
customer_reviews.author: Corey

customer_reviews.title: Looks nice, but will not adequarely heat a 75 gallon tank for Discus. Disappointing.
customer_reviews.text: This looks nice in the tank giving a nice easy to read display for the tanks temperature. However, it is NOT able to heat a tank enough to keep warm water fish such as discus. I have had a 300 watt running in my 75 gallon tank for 3 days set at 83 degrees, and yet the temperature has failed to record a reading past 80 degrees.
customer_reviews.author: Mark H

customer_reviews.title: Requires too
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my red eared slider turtles since it has a built in cage, and for that it works good. Other than that it’s a waste of money, switch on top already broke, so I can no longer adjust the temp, thankfully it’s set at 75 and seems to remember where it was at, even during a power outage. And it is always blinking LF (low flow) I’ve put the air bubbles under it, cleaned it, re positioned it, and it will still randomly throw the LF code. Now that I got a sump I’ll be tossing this and getting just a regular heater with none of this fancy technology that tends to fail.
customer_reviews.author: Brett

customer_reviews.title: Decent Design but Low Power
customer_reviews.text: The heater seems to be well designed. Unfortunately, for some reason, these heaters seem to deliver much less thermal energy than would be expected for their power rating. Three 300 W heaters should be able to heat 160G of water to a stable temp of 77, right? I have them all set for 80 but temp varies 75 - 77, it never gets to 80. It may get there this Summer but that is not when heaters are needed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Freshwater heater
customer_reviews.text: good heater, had an aqueon heater before this one which worked fine. Bought this one for new tank and works great! It will let you know low flow, too hot or too cold and also gives you current temp in tank, so no need for extra thermometer! Would recommend
customer_reviews.author: Rel

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Heater
customer_reviews.text: I have a 150 gallon aquarium and two of these heaters running it. They maintain the temperature they are set on without highs and lows. They've outlast and out perform any heaters I've ever used in this tank. After almost 6 years one of them finally had to be replaced. A tremendous product!
customer_reviews.author: Fred

customer_reviews.title: Great reliable heater!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had two other non “name-brand” heaters for my 75 gallon saltwater tank that couldn’t seem to keep the heat high enough when it gets colder (and I live in the south, so it doesn’t get crazy cold). This heater works like a charm. Ive had no errors and no fluctuations in temperature whatsoever
customer_reviews.author: S. Sisson

customer_reviews.title: I think it was a good decision to add this to my
customer_reviews.text: I have this heated in my 75 gal reef tank and it holds steady temperature, and I must admit it is usally within a half a degree of my digital thermometer which is located on the opposite end of the tank. I think it was a good decision to add this to my tank
customer_reviews.author: Big G

customer_reviews.title: Great thermometer.
customer_reviews.text: Best thermometer I have used. Would buy again. Digital thermostat is really nice and easy to set and read. The safety feature of the cage is nice in case of burning fish that like to hide behind the thermometer. Looks high tech and offers feedback on heating capacity and tank conditions.
customer_reviews.author: Some Guy

customer_reviews.title: now with lights!
customer_reviews.text: I have needed a heater that I can see, I need a temp gauge I can see, this answered both problems with aplomb. green for good red for bad, I can see it from my couch, so can you!
customer_reviews.author: clearway

customer_reviews.title: This heat has no way to know if it is ON
customer_reviews.text: This heat has no way to know if it is ON! .... Recently I came home and my tank was reading blue! I unplugged/plugged it and it started work working again.... I hope this thing doesn't end up killing my fish! It is great to see the temperature, but no light indicator for on...
customer_reviews.author: Rodney S.

customer_reviews.title: Gets it close to set temperature but always a 1.5-2.5 degrees below what I set it for
customer_reviews.text: Love the way it looks, the various functions are nice but it has yet to hit the desired temperature. I have it setup in a 75 gallon freshwater aquarium, I have checked for nearby vents that might be blowing cool air near the tank, nothing. I have it sitting right next to the power-head that pushes water across it just like the instructions said. Disappointing but not a deal breaker for me.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Love the warning lights for low flow or a temp ...
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had 3 of these running for over 5 years. Not one failure. I have a standard thermometer in each tank to verify that the temp really does remain within a half of degree. The only minor issue is that it does need some flow, not much mind you. Love the warning lights for low flow or a temp excursion. Mine get knocked around with the live rock in my sump too. Reading about how unreliable aquarium heaters are, I can’t believe these don’t get more love.
customer_reviews.author: Bleeder

customer_reviews.title: It's just so great
customer_reviews.text: It is awesome and so easy to use! I would definitely recommend it. Oddly enough I have this in my Goldfish/catfish tank... don't ask. So I needed a good and stable heater that won't go all bonkers on me and cause either fish to die. I literally have it at a temperature that is on the high end for one fish and low end for the other. So far so good which I am thankful for. Love the Fluval brand, especially their heaters
customer_reviews.author: Liah05Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: A heater that doesn’t increase temperature past 81 degrees
customer_reviews.text: The temperature won’t increase past 81 degrees. I’ve tried it for 10 days now. I have Discus fish which need a higher temperature. My fish are very expensive. The product is flawed and I don’t want to risk losing them because of it. I’m returning it.
customer_reviews.author: avid reader

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with these. I own three, ones a bit tough to switch temps but overall the best one I’ve ever used. Accurate and shows temp. Does the job!
customer_reviews.author: Junior

customer_reviews.title: Good heater, love the temp read out
customer_reviews.text: 5 stars: So far it works great. I'm ordering another thermometer to verify the calibration. Draws exactly 300 Watts per my Neptune apex. Edit: 2 stars. 4 months later. I woke up this morning and my tank had dropped from 78 to 74, the heater was saying the correct temperature but not drawing any power! And I even cleaned it 2 weeks ago. Replacing this immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Caleb Chapman

customer_reviews.title: Lots for problems with temperature control and accuracy
customer_reviews.text: Will not get above 77 degrees (9 degrees) above room temperature. It stays on the blue screen and I am NOT geing a low flow error. Look for a better heater. If I unplug it and plug it back in the temperature will jump up or down by a few degrees, not accurate at all. Not worth the money
customer_reviews.author: JakeBeau26

customer_reviews.title: This works like it claims
customer_reviews.text: I was tired of having the floating thermometers in the tank and guessing that the temp is for the fish. This works like it claims. I have not had any problems with it. Worked great out of the box and I have it submerged in the tank and I keep the water just below the temp adjuster. I have had it for a few months and still working great and it nice the fish cant hurt them self's on the heater as it protected.
customer_reviews.author: Peter  M

customer_reviews.title: Very nice.
customer_reviews.text: Looks much better than a naked tube heater and the digital display is nice. Easily keeps my 60g tank at 77 degrees in a typical 70 degree room. Two advice points. When changing the temp, you have to be a little forceful on the click motion and then let go. Then do it again. The switch seems to stick a little. Also, the low current and auto shut off is a PAIN. Had to put directly next to the intake on my HOB filter.
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: I'd try something else
customer_reviews.text: After reading other reviews I decided to try myself. Well the low flow is a pain in the ass! I've moved the heater many different ways that people have said to try. Will work for awhile then back to the low flow readout!! I do like being able to see the tempbeasily! Also the light is quite bright on it! Almost a nightlight for room!!
customer_reviews.author: andrew smith

customer_reviews.title: Easy to read
customer_reviews.text: Works great, my old aqueon heater cracked so I decided to give this a try since I’m running slot of fluval device like my 406 filter it heats up quick and maintain well
customer_reviews.author: Wei Szeto

customer_reviews.title: Best Hands Down 1 heater for 150g tank? Unbelievable but its True!
customer_reviews.text: 1 Word AWESOME! I so trust this brand. this one heater is working on our 150g deep and long aquarium for our fish. its very consistant I have seen the air light come on via RED but that's when we were cleaning the tank and the sand was really floating around we have it near our water return and within a few short minutes it goes back to green you set the temp to what you want or need and its right on the money. I have had LOTS of different heaters over the years in all of my tanks and by far this has been the ABSOLUTE Best Hands down the greatest one I have found.
customer_reviews.author: trainersteven

customer_reviews.title: Like that it's digital.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. According to the specs it's way oversized for the 55 gallon tank I have it in and I use an additional heater because the room is colder and the directions say not to use it to heat 10 degrees warmer then the room.
customer_reviews.author: C'arma

customer_reviews.title: Add an air stone right under to fix water flow problem!!!
customer_reviews.text: I also had an issue where it would not heat to set temp. The water flow is key to achieving proper function. I have a 55 gallon with 2 double filter pad filters, and still had the water flow problem. Simple solution: I put an air stone directly under the heater, and let it bubble. Problem solved!!! I turn off the air pump, and sure enough, water flow is back on the display. Turn the air back on, good again. Great heater, and precision temp.
customer_reviews.author: Anita S.

customer_reviews.title: Horrible
customer_reviews.text: Maybe the worst heater I have ever purchased, does not keep a constant temp ,has low flow error and it sets by power head.Not what I expected from fluval .
customer_reviews.author: EARNEST

customer_reviews.title: Defective.
customer_reviews.text: Didn't seem to work. Tried to use it in my 125 gallon tank. After 4 days, water temperature went from 74 to 78 when it was set to 85 but room temperature was getting higher anyway. I tested the water temperature near the heater and the heater itself, temperature was cool, so I don't think it is working at all.
customer_reviews.author: RZ

customer_reviews.title: Worked fine till i tried to turn the temperature up to 80.
customer_reviews.text: Iv had this heater since July 18, 2018. Recently I tried to increase the temperature to 80 and it so far has not reached 80. Right now it is flashing blue and it is at 75 degrees. I turned it off and left it off for a few minutes and turned it back on to see if that would make a difference. I am hoping it works because I don't want to buy another one. Update it's now 1/5/2019 and this heater is still in the blue and it is now at 72 degrees. It is not working properly at all. I have it set at 75 and recently moved it to 80 but it never reached 80.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Rock solid, working in a 55 gallon tank
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Installed in a 55 gallon tank with another that is slightly smaller as a backup. Took a few days to get within range of temp I needed but it's been holding great and we keep our house pretty cold. Love that I can see the blue/green light from a distance and know if I'm within temp range
customer_reviews.author: Brian Sirimaturos

customer_reviews.title: Returned it was defective
customer_reviews.text: Never got up to temperature. Used for several weeks and out of the blue it decided there wasn't enough water flow in a tank with a high powered canister filter. Returned for refund. I really liked the look because it blended in. Disappointed. Usually fluval delivers
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice to have a heater you can set to a ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice to have a heater you can set to a temp number and not just a dial you have to spin and guess it will heat to the temp you want. Seems to be doing a good job so far holding about a 1/2 degree difference than my electronic thermostat I have on the tank.
customer_reviews.author: Urban Legend

customer_reviews.title: Great heater,  accurate
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome little heater. The digital display with back-lit color is a cool feature too. The temp is very accurate and it keeps my 135gallon in the range I need it. I have it next to the exhaust on my fx6 and have had no low flow issues
customer_reviews.author: Richphotos

customer_reviews.title: USED HEATER!
customer_reviews.text: Heater arrived on time but is used. It is obviously a return and resell. Heater kicks on and off constantly. Luckily I was home for several hours after the installation and caught the problem. Could have easily killed my reef tank!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: You pay for what you get!!!!! A premium aquarium thermometer.
customer_reviews.text: Expensive compared to other aquarium heaters,... but worth every penny. Protective “housing” of the glass tube parents cracking or shattering if dropped or tapped against aquarium wall. Water temperature indicator light is easy to read. Red toggle switch for temperature change is simple . Also, digital read out of water temp is clear and precise. I am very impressed !
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: "Advanced " piece of junk.
customer_reviews.text: If you live in a colder home or have an air conditioner going don't bother buying this heater. It will not be able to keep the temperature at correct range. I have it set for 78. It can't even get to 76. At night it drops to 69. At random times it says low flow or "lf" . If I put anymore flow in the tank water will start splashing out. You're better off buying a regular heater.
customer_reviews.author: Kaitlinlaf24

customer_reviews.title: Temp control malfunctioned after less than a month.
customer_reviews.text: Heater stopped working correctly after less than a month. Temp could only be raised and not decreased. Very inconvenient as my cichlids have to be cooped up in a 10 gallon tank until I can get a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy Habicht

customer_reviews.title: Great company
customer_reviews.text: Love the digital read out display of temperature. Color coded: Blue- too cold; green- just right; red- too hot. After three years it stopped working. I contacted the company(by email) and they asked that I clean it and get back to them. Cleaning did not help so I got back to them (by email with copy of receipt from Amazon) and within hours they had a new unit sent out to me saying I would receive it in 1-5 days. The new unit arrived as promised, never having sent back the old one. Will buy from this company every chance I get!
customer_reviews.author: yaelz

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: Longer than i needed it to be. But keeps my 70gal in check. I like the led light change when the water is below temp blue, at temp green, over temp red
customer_reviews.author: Dominique Sams

customer_reviews.title: after 3 Mos Temperature changer broke
customer_reviews.text: Its a great looking heater and when it worked it was great. (in my 75 gal) I followed everyone's suggestion of putting it by a wave maker to avoid "LOW FLOW" warnings. After 3 months, its just sitting back in the box, I just want a refund and will probably stay away from such heaters as this one. Also, reaching out to customer support is a pain. I would avoid this, just stick to your regular heaters.
customer_reviews.author: Greenor

customer_reviews.title: Intelligent heat
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the 300 watt unit for my 55 gal tank. We keep the house cool and this is keeping the water at exactly the temp that I need. Initially, it wasn't bringing the heat up and then I realized that the screen was indicating that the heater was in an area of "low flow". I moved it to a spot in the tank where the water has greater movement and it has now brought the temp up to 76 degrees. It's nice to have the insight that this unit provides. I've had tropical fish for about 40 years and this is by far the best heater I've ever had.
customer_reviews.author: MusicLover

customer_reviews.title: Great heater
customer_reviews.text: What can I say? Does exactly what it's supposed to do. I have this in a 125 gallon reef tank. Initially it was the sole source of heating, and it was able to keep the tank at 75 degrees. I added another heater just to ensure I had some backup, but this heater was able to keep up. The plastic façade is awesome as it will keep the glass heater itself from getting damaged in any way, and the digital display is easy to read and very easy to set.
customer_reviews.author: Scott H.

customer_reviews.title: Only worked when turned sideways, died within a year.
customer_reviews.text: Like other reviewers said, even though it's designed to sit upright it only works when it's horizontal or at an angle. And the suction cup mount isn't designed to hold it horizontal or at an angle so good luck getting it to stay that way. Lasted almost a year before it stopped working entirely.
customer_reviews.author: CoA

customer_reviews.title: doesn’t work for me
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to love this heater. I love the temp display and casing. However, it can’t keep up with my 90 gal tank. I bought this heater as a backup heater. A few days after I got this one in the tank, my old heater died. The next day, my tank temp had dropped from 81 to 75.5. I tried giving it more time to catch up to no avail. I ended up having to buy another $50 heater from Petsmart.
customer_reviews.author: Amber Dawn Constable

customer_reviews.title: Nice,costly but sure it will be ok
customer_reviews.text: Funky about Lf keeps coming up.. no matter where i move it. So that is my only issue..
customer_reviews.author: chris234

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money for a better more efficient heater
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace a failed no name heater so far I love it, easy temp settings shows current temp of the water and color coded warning for too hot, too cold and in the green zone water temp. Awesome product like all of Fluval products.
customer_reviews.author: Randall Crane

customer_reviews.title: This heater is easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This heater is easy to use. The directions are a little confusing but if you have used a submersible heater before that will not matter. This is the best heater I've purchased so far. I'm using this in a 75 gallon water aquarium for a turtle. The turtle loves it...he sleeps while resting his hands and head on it in winter months. I keep the temperature between 74 and 76. It's very durable. Definitely worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: ler

customer_reviews.title: Fail
customer_reviews.text: Doesnt heat water to set temp...confusing operations could have easily been avoided with a remote control included---- and not forced drop another 80 bucks!!!
customer_reviews.author: MUDBONE

customer_reviews.title: I wanted to love it, but I don't
customer_reviews.text: I read all the reviews and found two common sentiments: 1 - people love it, 2 - in some cases, it was reported to not be very effective. I took the risk and purchased the 300w version to use in my 55gal tank. I can confirm that it is very weak and sometimes cannot maintain 72 degrees overnight in my main family room (2nd floor). Room temperature never goes lower than 16 degrees. I wanted to love this product, but I don't think I can recommend it, nor do I think I will repurchase it at a later date.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: won't maintain temp
customer_reviews.text: bought 300w version for 45 gallon tank. You must set heater 4 degrees higher than desired temperature. Worst feature is low flow rate sensor - it flashes as low flow rate but it is in a tank with high water flow with nothing blocking the heater.
customer_reviews.author: A Younger

customer_reviews.title: Dont even look at this heater.
customer_reviews.text: This heater looks and sounds like it cant be beat, but there's a catch. Just look online at all the known problems that other aquarists have . I wish I did. I bought 2 300 watt heaters and both of them read the water about 2 degrees cooler then what it is. I've tested my waters temp with multiple thermometers and they are 100 % just wrong with the water temp. Just dont waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: No flow error here
customer_reviews.text: I'm so glad I didn't listen to the negative reviews about the flow error. Installed after water change and added cooler water to watch and monitor. Raised to proper temp and is holding steady. No issues at all. Just install where you have good water flow and you will be very happy with this product
customer_reviews.author: TG

customer_reviews.title: This is fluvals worst product. Im on my 3rd and last fluval ...
customer_reviews.text: This is fluvals worst product. Im on my 3rd and last fluval heater. 2 out of the threes heaters ive bought have been duds. Its way over priced, the one heater i do have works great on the 150 tank. The last one i bought is just a over priced thermometer. This is sad because every thing eles i use for the aquarium is from fluval and ive never had a problem with there products. Do your self a favor and just buy one at the pet store. Dont waste your money on this heater.
customer_reviews.author: david conway

customer_reviews.title: Good so far
customer_reviews.text: Only had it a few weeks but the 300 watt has worked good so far. My room temp is 60-65F and it does a good job at keeping my tank at 76F, only thing is that it seems to stay at 75F more than I'd like
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany Davis

customer_reviews.title: Too finicky
customer_reviews.text: Tried this in a new 75 gallon tank we were just setting up. I'm happy for all the people who could get this thing to work but I'm not one of them. I tried all the suggestions I read in the reviews here: vertical, horizontal, put it directly in the output stream of my Fluval 406, put in in a bubbler stream but the best I could get was 71 degrees F with intermittent LF (low flow) errors. Amazon let me exchange it for a Aqueon Adjustable Submersible Aquarium Heater, 300W and it just works with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: SLS

customer_reviews.title: Once again, received items that have previously returned.
customer_reviews.text: Seems like getting items that have been returned before has become the norm. I bought this aquarium heater and an aquarium pump, both had been previously returned. I , probably like most people , don't want an item that has been returned, so I don't think it's unreasonable to complain. After all, there must be a reason it was returned. You can tell if something has been sold before if you know what to look for.
customer_reviews.author: Rodney G.

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Not sure why there were stars for suction power but it got a 0 rating for that everything else has been 5 star! Unless there is something I do not know about this heater. I have been using this heater for about a year now and it has always kept the temp in my 90gal reef tank at a constant temperature.
customer_reviews.author: Munk_h

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Read, Lighted, Color-Coded Temperature Readout
customer_reviews.text: My husband is impressed with the features of this heater. The lighted temperature display window makes monitoring the temp a breeze and knowing that it will change colors to alert if the water temp is too hot (red) or too cold (blue) gives peace of mind.
customer_reviews.author: Eileen

product_meta.title: Fluval E Electronic Heater
product_meta.description:
Size:300-watt| Product Packaging:Standard Packaging

Maintaining proper temperature is one of the most important factors in aquarium care. The Fluval E Heaters continuously monitor and display aquarium water temperature, ensuring the well-being of your aquarium inhabitants. Simply the most technologically advanced submersible aquarium heaters available today, the Fluval E Series features VueTech technology. With the easy to use adjustment lever, the temperature can be precisely set in 0.5° increments. Its LCD display delivers peace of mind by continuously showing real time water temperatures. During normal operation the temperature readout will change color if the aquarium water varies +/-2 degrees F or more from the pre-set temperature. Should any external heat sources or other equipment, such as chillers, cause the aquarium water temperature to rise or fall beyond 5.5 °F, the colored screen will flash, indicating a potential risk. The ability to measure temperature in Celsius is also an option. The integrated fish guard offers advanced protection. Fish and invertebrates cannot come into direct contact with the heater core. The glass sleeve is also protected against shocks from large fish species. Built with a secure slim profile mounting bracket. The heater can be adjusted or removed without removing the mounting bracket. The great asset of the mounting bracket is its ability for you to mount the heater at varied angles, so you can view the front screen in any direction you wish. For those with a marine aquarium and sump, you can also attach the Fluval E heater there.

WARNING: The heater must never be operated outside of the aquarium. If the water level falls below the minimum water level MIN, the thermostat can no longer "read” the water temperature and therefore can no longer control the heating correctly. If it has to be taken out of the water or when transferring or changing the water, disconnect the heater from the power source and wait for at least 30 minutes to allow it to cool down.
feature_bullets: Aquarium heater with dual temperature sensors provide accurate and real-time water temperatures
LCD temperature display available in both Fahrenheit and Celsius; with a range of 68 to 93 degrees Fahrenheit
Fast heat technology built with a safety shut-off and integrated fish guard to protect fish and invertebrates
Equipped with a slim profile mounting bracket and colored display alert system
300-watt heater for freshwater and saltwater aquariums up to 100 gallons with a 5-year warranty

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
